{Reviewer: Chelsey Kade
Rating: 5/5
Time: a week ago
Review: My son had his second birthday party here and it was perfect!!! We had 30 adults and 23 children and it fit perfectly !!! We did the ultimate package and it was well worth it! The company is family owned and they were amazing to work with. The establishment was very clean and there was plenty of parking. I highly recommend this place for a fun day with your kids or to have a kids party!! Even the pizza they had was so delicious!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Nicole Brooks
Rating: 5/5

Review: My family and I celebrated My daughter‚Äôs second birthday here. From beginning to end it was such a smooth process and really made my job a lot easier as far as prep work went. Miss Michelle and the rest of the staff were amazing! The package I purchased included a theme of my choice, them setting everything up for the party all decorations, paper plates, etc. included! Afterwards, they cleaned everything up for me which gave me a lot more time to be able to just enjoy the party and my baby. I am so grateful for this place and the wonderful people who own it, and I hope that they stay in business forever! I would also like to add that it was very clean. It smelt clean upon entrance, which also made me feel a whole lot better for my baby and the other kiddos that were playing truly a great place to have a party. If you have a toddler, they will be extremely entertained, and the parents can even take a seat on the sofa and relax as they watch the kids play!

Reviewer: Kathy Duong
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Fidgets is a small playground that my daughter and I have been frequenting for the past two years. Whenever I need a moment of relaxation and she needs some playtime, we know exactly where to go!

One of the things that I truly appreciate about Fidgets is the sense of safety it provides for my daughter. The playground is just the right size - not too big - allowing me to always have a clear view and hear her voice from across the room. It brings me peace of mind.

Moreover, Fidgets is equipped with a variety of toys suitable for kids of all ages, ranging from 1 to 6 or 7 years old. It ensures that every child's play needs are met. Additionally, I find the place to be consistently clean, which is a huge plus for me as a parent. The staff members are always friendly and welcoming, making our visits even more enjoyable.

I wanted to reach out and share my positive experience with you. If you're ever in need of a safe and fun environment for your child, I highly recommend checking out  Fidgets. I'm confident you'll have a similar experience.

Reviewer: Miesha Tate
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 years ago
Review: We hosted a dual birthday here for 2nd and 4th Birthday for our Daughter and son. We had to pick 1 theme (they provide plates and some decorations) so we went with Encanto. For our son we brought some of our own decorations and they had no issue with that.

They have packages that include pizza and drinks as well as either face painting or a character that comes to entertain the kids, we chose the face painting and it was a huge hit!

It‚Äôs also nice they have early time slots for party (I think we chose 10am-12pm) reservations as I find with small kids it‚Äôs usually easier to get things done in the morning before they get sleepy and cranky.

The playground is clean and the service was great.

One thing to remember is bring your own socks! Adults and kids have to wear socks no shoes allowed inside but if you forget them they are available for purchase at the front.

Popular play items for my kids are the ball pit and the train they can ride around! There‚Äôs also dress up that my daughter really loves!

We also come here regularly just to play, my kids love it

We did the Mickey and Friends theme and the decorations were amazing and it was so lovely to not have to decorate or clean up. We would definitely recommend this to other parents and consider using Fidgets next year for our daughter's birthday as well! Thanks Michelle for a great party!

Review: We were in Vegas for a week (end of August) and attended this facility about 4-5 times. We had a fantastic experience. The owners were incredibly friendly and accommodating. Most importantly, the facility is more intimate and not as loud/hectic as other indoor playgrounds.

There are plenty of different toys for children to experience. We really valued that the size was more intimate (it made our children less distracted and not as over stimulated as the louder, super bright/neon/flashy places) but most importantly, this Wigglin' Out is OPEN EARLIER than all the other places.

The earlier open hours were key because most children are up early so to have to wait until 11 am to start burning off energy is too close to lunch/nap times. Now keep in mind, we were visiting from Canada so I recognize that earlier weekday hours may not be as important for locals.

But for us, as tourists, this venue was excellent: wonderful customer service, more calm/intimate setting, and better opening hours.

Reviewer: B
Rating: 1/5
Time: Edited a month ago
Review: I have been here multiple times, and I almost booked a birthday party here one year.. but we were in the area so I had decided to play here last Sunday. But we couldn‚Äôt even get inside. And after I found out what happened, I will NEVER return.
The parking lot had at least 30 cops, and I asked one grandma, as She was being shuffled out of the building, what happened? This is as the police were taping off the parking lot area, and eventually, the front door after hurrying several other people out of there. She told me, ‚Äúgo, get out of here! There was gunfire! Go!‚Äù I will absolutely not return after that, for obvious reasons.

But despite that incident‚Ä¶ I would still give this place 1 star because they never keep anything clean. We used to come here a lot, but we had stopped and went to different indoor playgrounds because nearly every time that we would come here, within the next 2-3 days, my kid was sick. And he would end up with an ear infection as a result, and it was really bad. It was at least three separate times that we came to LOL and my son was sick a couple days after.
My son was only 2 then, and I was at home with him all the time.. he couldn‚Äôt have got sick from anywhere but here as he was not in daycare, and we really didn‚Äôt leave the house very much at all, therefore I know that it had to have been at LOL that he got sick. Kids will be running around coughing and sneezing and still playing and touching everything. If your kid is sick you should not bring them out to a place like this, obviously, but soo many people do it anyways! So rude.

The staff could have done temperate checks during cold/flu season? Or if they saw an obviously sick child, ask the family to leave and sanitize the area? But you don‚Äôt see the staff ever cleaning anything here. The tables are a mess a lot of the time, the play area is worse. They only walk around with a leaf blower to ‚Äúclean‚Äù up the ballpit balls that have gone astray. Never seen anyone wipe anything down.
You can tell they don‚Äôt really care to clean much of the many surfaces because obvious shoe marks, dirt, etc. all over the play area and floor. The ball pit balls feel disgusting and greasy. It‚Äôs the worst on the high levels of the play area. I‚Äôve climbed to the very top which is very high up and that‚Äôs where it looks the dirtiest, probably because it‚Äôs not as accessible as the ground floor and most parents aren‚Äôt up there to notice. But why are there dirty shoe marks when it is a ‚Äúsocks only‚Äù facility anyways?!

It is too bad the staff/owner don‚Äôt really care, because this place would be great if I was just judging the playground equipment! Unfortunately, they allow in what I feel like is more than their capacity should be, and the place is flooded with kids running left and right, no staff supervision anywhere at all, and they don‚Äôt clean a thing afterwards.
The owners obviously don‚Äôt care to change their policies and improve this place as I‚Äôve seen numerous other reviews that were recently posted.
Overall they lack sanitation for a children‚Äôs facility and we saw the aftermath of an extremely dangerous hazard in a children‚Äôs play place‚Ä¶ so thankful we weren‚Äôt inside when this occurred and I hope everyone was okay.
I hope they get shut down after this incident, it is so not ok for this to have been happening at a place for kids. If they stay open I think they should install metal detectors & hire a decent cleaning crew to sanitize this place.
Will never return ever. I already avoided coming here when my kid would ask, instead I‚Äôd suggest a different indoor playground, but now it will be a hard no.
I wouldn‚Äôt have even came here today in the first place, but we happened to be nearby on that side of town, so I said fine we will go.
But driving there, I kept telling my son, don‚Äôt put your hands in your mouth or on your face, unless you want to get sick!

Reviewer: Gianna Griffin
Rating: 1/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: My daughter recently hosted my twin granddaughter's birthday party at LOL Kids, and unfortunately, I can‚Äôt recommend this place. My daughter paid $1600 for their Ultimate Package, which included 3 rooms, food (8 large pizzas, 2 appetizer platters, 2 salad platters), unlimited drinks, and icee treats for the kids. While the price was hefty, we expected great service and a smooth experience for such a special occasion ‚Äì but that wasn‚Äôt the case.

Issues we faced:
1.	Shoes Policy Problems: Upon arrival, we were told all adults had to remove their shoes. This included elders and people with health issues who would be sitting the entire time. We had to argue with staff to get waivers to allow our elderly family members to keep their shoes on, which should have been handled more gracefully.

2.	Room Mix-Up: To our surprise, when we got to our reserved rooms, they were given away to another party. We spent nearly 45 minutes sorting this out, and the issue wasn‚Äôt resolved until we spoke with the owner. The excuse they gave was that they thought we were part of another party, but no one bothered to confirm anything. It was very frustrating, and we didn‚Äôt even get into our rooms until an hour after the scheduled party time. As compensation for the inconvenience, the owner gave us a frozen tiramisu cake and two fruit trays ‚Äì hardly an adequate fix.

3.	Poor Food and Service: The service at the party was subpar. The host was unprofessional, and we had to repeatedly ask for refills on drinks and inquire about the food. We were given random food substitutions, like ranch dressing instead of the Caesar dressing we ordered. When we asked the staff about it, they acted like they didn‚Äôt know what we were talking about, and one of the workers at the register admitted they had just run out of the correct dressing. Additionally, we had to keep asking for plates, cups, and basic items, which seemed to annoy the host.

For the amount of money we paid, we expected much better service and attention to detail. The staff seemed disorganized and uninterested in providing a positive experience.
Final Thoughts: If you‚Äôre planning to book a party for your children here, be prepared for potential stress and poor service. The lack of professionalism, mix-ups with reservations, and inattentiveness from the staff made this a frustrating and disappointing experience. For the price, there are certainly better venues that will respect your time, money, and your child‚Äôs special day.

Reviewer: Mama_ KT_
Rating: 1/5
Time: 10 months ago
Review: I never thought I'd leave a review wishing for a zero or negative star option, but here we are. I've been to this children's play place more than once, and my previous experience was disappointing due to the cleanliness of the play area and the staff's attitude. We let a Groupon expire because I didn‚Äôt want to return. But after my daughter kept asking to go for the last two weeks, I figured we‚Äôd give it another shot, hoping it had improved. Unfortunately, it‚Äôs worse than ever.

We visited on Saturday, 8/24/24, meeting friends for a playdate when the place opened. After letting the kids (both 5 years old) settle in, we sat down, periodically checking on them. The floors in the seating areas were filthy, covered in shoe and sock prints, and this was right after opening. Then, my daughter came over and told me she stepped on glass. Shocked, I asked her to show me where. Meanwhile, her friend showed her mom a small injury she had gotten while trying to avoid the glass, causing her to fall and land on the glass, which ripped her new leggings and cut her knee, making it bleed.

I walked over and saw glass scattered everywhere near the front windows. Another parent mentioned that their child had found the rock that had clearly broken the window. When my friend asked for a bandaid and the staff saw her daughter's bleeding leg, they told her it had already been cleaned up. I then informed them that was definitely not the case; glass was still all over the mats. This is a play place where kids are required to wear socks only. One child was already bleeding, and that was the staff‚Äôs response? A few of us parents started using toys to barricade off the area because the glass had spread over a large area. There was no urgency from the staff; they eventually came over with brooms and said, "It's not our fault people keep breaking our windows." True, it‚Äôs not their fault, but it is their responsibility to maintain a safe environment for the kids.

Despite our concerns, the girls wanted to keep playing, so we kept them away from that area. The staff‚Äôs cleaning efforts were inadequate‚Äîthey didn‚Äôt even bother to get a vacuum to clean up the shards of glass on the mats. They removed our barricades. It wasn‚Äôt until the owner arrived later that the staff finally brought out a shop vac and sealed the window to clean up the glass properly. Yet, the owner never checked in with my friend to see how her daughter was doing.

When our kids got hungry, we ordered food: one large pizza and an order of chicken spring rolls. The food took a long time to arrive. When I bit into the spring rolls, I found a triangular piece of bone inside the chopped chicken. I took multiple pictures as proof. Then I noticed a rash on my friend‚Äôs daughter, which hadn‚Äôt been there before. That was the last straw; we decided it was time to go.

This place is a disaster‚Äîthe staff is terrible, and there‚Äôs zero regulation on older kids roughhousing. An older boy, maybe 8-10 years old, was grabbing my daughter‚Äôs hands in the ball pit, and I had to intervene calmly. No parents were in sight.

When you go to a play place, there‚Äôs an expectation of cleanliness, kindness, and safety‚Äîthis place has none of those. To top it off, only one sink in the women‚Äôs bathroom worked, the paper towel dispenser handle was broken, one toilet was out of order, and another was clogged. The toys, like the large Legos and the balls, were filthy, and even my daughter mentioned that the slides were dirty.

We had to explain to our girls that we were leaving because it wasn‚Äôt safe‚Äîbetween the broken glass, the bone in my food, and the rash, it was time to go and never come back. I‚Äôve mentioned this experience to other mom friends, and they all had horrible things to say about this place. I have no idea how this place is still open; it needs to be shut down.

Review: We went on a Saturday night, and it wasn't crazy busy, which I was happy about. It's a very large play place, and sometimes, when it's too busy, the little ones get hurt/run over by older kids. All the kids, for the most part, appeared to be under 6 when I was there.  The jungle gym is big enough that a parent is able to climb through it as well. Seemed pretty clean, didn't go to the restrooms which I hate because you're in socks only. They have some arcade games, but after spending $18 to get in, it can get expensive playing games. The birthday space I wasn't impressed with simply because it's all linked together in one large room.  Just rows of tables, maybe 10 - 15, so you don't have a personal space. You're behind glass separated from the general public, but not from anyone else having a birthday party at the same time. There's plenty of seating available for parents while the kids play, and the snack bar has a nice variety of items. Pricing wise they're high, but it's a play place so I expected it. It was almost $7 for a small slurpee (6 or 8oz I believe) and bottle of water.  The air guns in the playpen weren't working and there are several of them. Looked like no one had checked them to see because balls were stuck in them that weren't intended for the guns. Review: ***WARNING*** Worst Birthday Party experience ever......

We booked the party in Aug. For today Nov. 11th. At the time of booking I was told IF more than 15 kids showed I would be charged for the 22 child count party. OK not a problem.

I was also told we would get 2 full hours in the party room.

When I arrived today I was CHARGED for the 22 child party as soon as I walk through the door. They did not even wait for the head count. Then also asked for a TIP. Right as we arrived.

The employees could have cared less about helping us set up the party!!!

The "party host" with the party was virtually none existent. We did basically everything ourselves from set up to clean up!

When the party was about over we were told to vacate the party room before the party for even over. BEFORE the 2 hour mark! The hostess finally showed up and said we could stay additional time for another $50.00.

When I went to the cashier she number 1 refused to give us out money back because it was a 15 child party not 22.

Secondly, she refused to give us an additional few mintues in the party room that the hostess communicated we could pay for.

NOT one person was kind or courteous. There was very poor communication. We were for lack of better terms over charged for the party head count.

Not a family friendly or good customer service experience at all.

Reviewer: B
Rating: 1/5
Time: Edited a month ago
Review: I have been here multiple times, and I almost booked a birthday party here one year.. but we were in the area so I had decided to play here last Sunday. But we couldn‚Äôt even get inside. And after I found out what happened, I will NEVER return.
The parking lot had at least 30 cops, and I asked one grandma, as She was being shuffled out of the building, what happened? This is as the police were taping off the parking lot area, and eventually, the front door after hurrying several other people out of there. She told me, ‚Äúgo, get out of here! There was gunfire! Go!‚Äù I will absolutely not return after that, for obvious reasons.

But despite that incident‚Ä¶ I would still give this place 1 star because they never keep anything clean. We used to come here a lot, but we had stopped and went to different indoor playgrounds because nearly every time that we would come here, within the next 2-3 days, my kid was sick. And he would end up with an ear infection as a result, and it was really bad. It was at least three separate times that we came to LOL and my son was sick a couple days after.
My son was only 2 then, and I was at home with him all the time.. he couldn‚Äôt have got sick from anywhere but here as he was not in daycare, and we really didn‚Äôt leave the house very much at all, therefore I know that it had to have been at LOL that he got sick. Kids will be running around coughing and sneezing and still playing and touching everything. If your kid is sick you should not bring them out to a place like this, obviously, but soo many people do it anyways! So rude.

The staff could have done temperate checks during cold/flu season? Or if they saw an obviously sick child, ask the family to leave and sanitize the area? But you don‚Äôt see the staff ever cleaning anything here. The tables are a mess a lot of the time, the play area is worse. They only walk around with a leaf blower to ‚Äúclean‚Äù up the ballpit balls that have gone astray. Never seen anyone wipe anything down.
You can tell they don‚Äôt really care to clean much of the many surfaces because obvious shoe marks, dirt, etc. all over the play area and floor. The ball pit balls feel disgusting and greasy. It‚Äôs the worst on the high levels of the play area. I‚Äôve climbed to the very top which is very high up and that‚Äôs where it looks the dirtiest, probably because it‚Äôs not as accessible as the ground floor and most parents aren‚Äôt up there to notice. But why are there dirty shoe marks when it is a ‚Äúsocks only‚Äù facility anyways?!

It is too bad the staff/owner don‚Äôt really care, because this place would be great if I was just judging the playground equipment! Unfortunately, they allow in what I feel like is more than their capacity should be, and the place is flooded with kids running left and right, no staff supervision anywhere at all, and they don‚Äôt clean a thing afterwards.
The owners obviously don‚Äôt care to change their policies and improve this place as I‚Äôve seen numerous other reviews that were recently posted.
Overall they lack sanitation for a children‚Äôs facility and we saw the aftermath of an extremely dangerous hazard in a children‚Äôs play place‚Ä¶ so thankful we weren‚Äôt inside when this occurred and I hope everyone was okay.
I hope they get shut down after this incident, it is so not ok for this to have been happening at a place for kids. If they stay open I think they should install metal detectors & hire a decent cleaning crew to sanitize this place.
Will never return ever. I already avoided coming here when my kid would ask, instead I‚Äôd suggest a different indoor playground, but now it will be a hard no.
I wouldn‚Äôt have even came here today in the first place, but we happened to be nearby on that side of town, so I said fine we will go.
But driving there, I kept telling my son, don‚Äôt put your hands in your mouth or on your face, unless you want to get sick!

Reviewer: Gianna Griffin
Rating: 1/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: My daughter recently hosted my twin granddaughter's birthday party at LOL Kids, and unfortunately, I can‚Äôt recommend this place. My daughter paid $1600 for their Ultimate Package, which included 3 rooms, food (8 large pizzas, 2 appetizer platters, 2 salad platters), unlimited drinks, and icee treats for the kids. While the price was hefty, we expected great service and a smooth experience for such a special occasion ‚Äì but that wasn‚Äôt the case.

Issues we faced:
1.	Shoes Policy Problems: Upon arrival, we were told all adults had to remove their shoes. This included elders and people with health issues who would be sitting the entire time. We had to argue with staff to get waivers to allow our elderly family members to keep their shoes on, which should have been handled more gracefully.

2.	Room Mix-Up: To our surprise, when we got to our reserved rooms, they were given away to another party. We spent nearly 45 minutes sorting this out, and the issue wasn‚Äôt resolved until we spoke with the owner. The excuse they gave was that they thought we were part of another party, but no one bothered to confirm anything. It was very frustrating, and we didn‚Äôt even get into our rooms until an hour after the scheduled party time. As compensation for the inconvenience, the owner gave us a frozen tiramisu cake and two fruit trays ‚Äì hardly an adequate fix.

3.	Poor Food and Service: The service at the party was subpar. The host was unprofessional, and we had to repeatedly ask for refills on drinks and inquire about the food. We were given random food substitutions, like ranch dressing instead of the Caesar dressing we ordered. When we asked the staff about it, they acted like they didn‚Äôt know what we were talking about, and one of the workers at the register admitted they had just run out of the correct dressing. Additionally, we had to keep asking for plates, cups, and basic items, which seemed to annoy the host.

For the amount of money we paid, we expected much better service and attention to detail. The staff seemed disorganized and uninterested in providing a positive experience.
Final Thoughts: If you‚Äôre planning to book a party for your children here, be prepared for potential stress and poor service. The lack of professionalism, mix-ups with reservations, and inattentiveness from the staff made this a frustrating and disappointing experience. For the price, there are certainly better venues that will respect your time, money, and your child‚Äôs special day.

Reviewer: Mama_ KT_
Rating: 1/5
Time: 10 months ago
Review: I never thought I'd leave a review wishing for a zero or negative star option, but here we are. I've been to this children's play place more than once, and my previous experience was disappointing due to the cleanliness of the play area and the staff's attitude. We let a Groupon expire because I didn‚Äôt want to return. But after my daughter kept asking to go for the last two weeks, I figured we‚Äôd give it another shot, hoping it had improved. Unfortunately, it‚Äôs worse than ever.

We visited on Saturday, 8/24/24, meeting friends for a playdate when the place opened. After letting the kids (both 5 years old) settle in, we sat down, periodically checking on them. The floors in the seating areas were filthy, covered in shoe and sock prints, and this was right after opening. Then, my daughter came over and told me she stepped on glass. Shocked, I asked her to show me where. Meanwhile, her friend showed her mom a small injury she had gotten while trying to avoid the glass, causing her to fall and land on the glass, which ripped her new leggings and cut her knee, making it bleed.

I walked over and saw glass scattered everywhere near the front windows. Another parent mentioned that their child had found the rock that had clearly broken the window. When my friend asked for a bandaid and the staff saw her daughter's bleeding leg, they told her it had already been cleaned up. I then informed them that was definitely not the case; glass was still all over the mats. This is a play place where kids are required to wear socks only. One child was already bleeding, and that was the staff‚Äôs response? A few of us parents started using toys to barricade off the area because the glass had spread over a large area. There was no urgency from the staff; they eventually came over with brooms and said, "It's not our fault people keep breaking our windows." True, it‚Äôs not their fault, but it is their responsibility to maintain a safe environment for the kids.

Despite our concerns, the girls wanted to keep playing, so we kept them away from that area. The staff‚Äôs cleaning efforts were inadequate‚Äîthey didn‚Äôt even bother to get a vacuum to clean up the shards of glass on the mats. They removed our barricades. It wasn‚Äôt until the owner arrived later that the staff finally brought out a shop vac and sealed the window to clean up the glass properly. Yet, the owner never checked in with my friend to see how her daughter was doing.

When our kids got hungry, we ordered food: one large pizza and an order of chicken spring rolls. The food took a long time to arrive. When I bit into the spring rolls, I found a triangular piece of bone inside the chopped chicken. I took multiple pictures as proof. Then I noticed a rash on my friend‚Äôs daughter, which hadn‚Äôt been there before. That was the last straw; we decided it was time to go.

This place is a disaster‚Äîthe staff is terrible, and there‚Äôs zero regulation on older kids roughhousing. An older boy, maybe 8-10 years old, was grabbing my daughter‚Äôs hands in the ball pit, and I had to intervene calmly. No parents were in sight.

When you go to a play place, there‚Äôs an expectation of cleanliness, kindness, and safety‚Äîthis place has none of those. To top it off, only one sink in the women‚Äôs bathroom worked, the paper towel dispenser handle was broken, one toilet was out of order, and another was clogged. The toys, like the large Legos and the balls, were filthy, and even my daughter mentioned that the slides were dirty.

We had to explain to our girls that we were leaving because it wasn‚Äôt safe‚Äîbetween the broken glass, the bone in my food, and the rash, it was time to go and never come back. I‚Äôve mentioned this experience to other mom friends, and they all had horrible things to say about this place. I have no idea how this place is still open; it needs to be shut down.

Leaking toilets while wearing socks, there are sandals but no sign if for public use so was unsure who's they were. Reviewer: Nadiyah Jones
Rating: 4/5
Time: a year ago
Review: We went on a Saturday night, and it wasn't crazy busy, which I was happy about. It's a very large play place, and sometimes, when it's too busy, the little ones get hurt/run over by older kids. All the kids, for the most part, appeared to be under 6 when I was there.  The jungle gym is big enough that a parent is able to climb through it as well. Seemed pretty clean, didn't go to the restrooms which I hate because you're in socks only. They have some arcade games, but after spending $18 to get in, it can get expensive playing games. The birthday space I wasn't impressed with simply because it's all linked together in one large room.  Just rows of tables, maybe 10 - 15, so you don't have a personal space. You're behind glass separated from the general public, but not from anyone else having a birthday party at the same time. There's plenty of seating available for parents while the kids play, and the snack bar has a nice variety of items. Pricing wise they're high, but it's a play place so I expected it. It was almost $7 for a small slurpee (6 or 8oz I believe) and bottle of water.  The air guns in the playpen weren't working and there are several of them. Looked like no one had checked them to see because balls were stuck in them that weren't intended for the guns. I wasn't able to pull them out, and even guns that had nothing stuck in them weren't working either. Overall, my daughter enjoyed herself so I'd definitely go back.

With two toddlers this is sort of unreasonable so i asked again if i can just pay for it as he was almost to the point of vomiting in the entry of the building. She just watched as he freaked out over this shark and literally no staff said anything just sorry we can‚Äôt do anything. Rating: 5/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: Went on a Saturday Evening and it definitely got busy, but it did not feel too crowded. Indoor playground was spacious and had many things to do for my two year old son. Would definitely go again, and would probably host a birthday party there.

What's inside?
- Huge ball-pit area + interactive projected screen
- Playground/jungle gym thing with swings, a large slide, obstacle courses, and guns that actually shoot the balls (unlike Uptown Jungle where the guns did not work)
- Party Rooms; decently sized and much colder compared to main area, and could fit around 20 people.
- Food area (didn't order myself but the party had pizzas, fries and drinks)
- Arcade area; I didn't personally check it out but it looked like a decent size.

My only "complaint" is that it was a bit warm in there, but I understand as it was a large space and must be difficult to keep cool. Also the restrooms could have been cleaner.

Staff was kind, had no issues.

Reviewer: Amber D.
Rating: 3/5
Time: 10 months ago
Review: Kidstopia is okay...

Pros: I liked the variety of play structures for the kids such as the bounce house, slide, spinning globe & Merry-Go-Round swings. They have a comfortable seating area with vending machines & massage chairs for parents. They have a large party room, that's great for birthdays and the staff was cleaning throughout the party to keep the area clean.

Cons- lots of broken games. Most games don't have "out of order signs" over the token slots so, kiddos are frustrated with machines. Some machines that "work" are missing buttons so you can't select different options. The token machine was out of order in the back with a broken foosball table.... making it confusing where to get tokens (At the front desk)?  The little swing sets have twine rope holding the swings together, I don't think it's sturdy enough for play (an accident waiting to happen).

Overall it's okay, but it's not Wally Wombats.

Reviewer: Janice ‚ÄúJan‚Äù Hartmann
Rating: 3/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Coming here was our grandson's choice, as he had been here once with his mom. The name has changed since then, to the current name , "Kid's Topia."

At first look, he was happily entertained, but after viewing so many broken toys and arcade games that we had spent money on, with no refunds, I can't recommend this place outside of a safe area for 5 and under to play.

The arcade games that work, I'd say, are geared for 6 and up, some older.  I guess they're trying to appeal to families with older and younger kids, to inculde them all.

The attendent was kind and kept on top of keeping the area sanitized and toys organized.

Lastly, the bathrooms were clean and brightly colored with fresh painted colors and equipment.

They have a nice couch sitting area for adults and snacks or lunches to bring in. Towels or something to clean the tables would be appreciated.

My three star rating was for safety and cleanliness, with two stars removed for broken arcades and equipment, with the no refund policy on tokens. My husband reminded me that it was about our grandson's enjoyment and that he had fun with another little boy he played with, so it was worth it.

Review: My family recently visited Kids Topia in South Durango, Las Vegas, and it was an absolutely delightful experience from start to finish. From the moment we stepped through the doors, we were greeted with a warm and welcoming atmosphere that immediately put us at ease.

One of the standout aspects of Kids Topia is the wonderful experience it offers for children. From colorful play structures to imaginative play areas, there was something for every child to enjoy.

The staff at Kids Topia are truly exceptional. They are not only friendly and approachable but also highly professional and attentive to the needs of the children.

Speaking of safety, I was impressed by the security measures in place at Kids Topia. The facility is always locked, providing an added layer of security for peace of mind. Additionally, the cleanliness standards are impeccable, with a strict shoes-off policy that helps to maintain a hygienic environment for children to play in.

Reviewer: Sam Villanueva
Rating: 5/5
Time: a month ago
Review: Wally Wombats is hands down one of the most delightful and family-friendly indoor playgrounds I‚Äôve ever visited. From the moment you step inside, you‚Äôre greeted by a warm and welcoming atmosphere that feels like a breath of fresh air for parents and an absolute wonderland for kids. The space is immaculately clean, thoughtfully designed, and bursting with creative energy‚Äîit's clear the team behind Wally Wombats truly cares about making every visit a memorable experience.

The play structures are incredible‚Äîcolorful, safe, and engaging for a wide range of ages. My kids could have stayed for hours exploring the climbing walls, tunnels, and slides, while the soft play areas are perfect for little ones who are just learning to crawl and walk. I especially appreciate the attention to safety: the staff keeps a watchful eye on the play zones, and everything from the flooring to the equipment feels high-quality and well-maintained.

What really sets Wally Wombats apart, though, is the heart behind it. The staff is exceptional‚Äîkind, patient, and genuinely enthusiastic about creating a positive environment. They go above and beyond to ensure families feel welcome and supported, whether it‚Äôs helping with a birthday party setup or offering a friendly smile when you need a coffee break. Speaking of which, the caf√© area is a fantastic touch! It‚Äôs a cozy space where parents can relax while the kids play, and the menu has plenty of options that make it easy to refuel without leaving the building.

Wally Wombats is also an incredible spot for hosting parties and special events. Their team takes care of the details so you can actually enjoy the day with your family, and they make every celebration feel special and unique.

Whether you're looking for a safe, engaging place for your kids to burn off energy or a welcoming community space for families to connect, Wally Wombats delivers in every way. It‚Äôs a gem in the community, and I couldn‚Äôt recommend it more highly. If you‚Äôre in the area, do yourself and your family a favor‚Äîcome experience the magic of Wally Wombats!

Review: There‚Äôs good and bad about this place. The reason I rated it three stars is due to the price being so high for an indoor playground verses what you get. 18.50 for one kid. Out of two bathrooms one of the doors lock didn‚Äôt work. It would probably benefit the business to have another employee on hand to tidy the space a bit. The actual play set is fairly small. They did have comfy couches and lots of floor toys. Ultimately, If the price was more reasonable I wouldn‚Äôt be as harsh. I feel other play places you pay less for more. I wish the owner well though and hope they can grow their business over time.
- [ ]

-----------------------

Reviewer: Kylee Crowther
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: This place is where it‚Äôs at!!!! My kids absolutely love coming to play. Not only do they have a fun place for kids, but they also have so many different events for families and all ages. They really cater to the public and make you feel like a VIP.  The customer service is also fantastic. If you‚Äôre looking to have a birthday party, or any other event, they make it happen exactly how you want it.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Ashton Baez
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: An absolute gem! VIP kids offers a diverse range of activities for all ages, including indoor play ground, board games, toys, air hockey, basketball, karaoke and video games. Impeccably clean and staffed with friendly faces, it's a haven for families. Kids enjoyed the playground and the activities, while the rest of the family rocked out to karaoke and battled it out on video games. A perfect blend of fun and entertainment for everyone!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Diego Barraza
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Great place highly recommend this location

-----------------------

Reviewer: Ariane Barrera
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: We went to VIPKids for my daughter‚Äôs birthday party. Kids of all ages had a wonderful time- including the grown ups!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Jessica O'Connor
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: I had my son's 5th birthday party at VIP Kids and everyone had a great time! The owners are so kind and accommodating and they can help you with anything that you need, even the clean up! I highly recommend VIP Kids for birthday parties, karaoke parties, adult parties, and video games!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Mark
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: From the moment we stepped into VIP Kids Indoor Play & More, Jasmine, the owner, welcomed us with such warmth and enthusiasm that we instantly felt like part of the VIP family. Her dedication to creating a vibrant and engaging environment for children is evident in every corner of the meticulously maintained facility, filled with a variety of fun and educational activities designed for kids of all ages. Jasmine's passion doesn't stop at the decor; she is actively involved in every event, ensuring each child and parent has a memorable experience.

The highlight of our visit was the costume party, a testament to Jasmine's commitment to providing extraordinary family experiences. She was there, engaging with parents and children alike, orchestrating games, handing out prizes, and even joining in the fun, which added a personal touch that made the event even more special. Seeing Jasmine interact with families, including my children and myself, highlighted how much she cares about fostering a community where children can safely play, learn, and grow.

What truly sets VIP Kids apart, under Jasmine's stewardship, is the sense of community and joy it fosters among families. Jasmine's attentive, friendly approach and her genuine passion for enriching children's lives shine through, making every visit feel personal and unique. The three hours of gameplay, laughter, and bonding flew by, leaving us all eagerly anticipating our next visit.

In conclusion, VIP Kids Indoor Play & More, under Jasmine's loving guidance, is more than just an indoor play center; it's a haven of happiness and growth for families. Her welcoming presence, along with the center's fantastic offerings, ensures that every family leaves with cherished memories and a longing to return. For anyone looking for an exceptional play experience that feels like home, VIP Kids, thanks to Jasmine, is the ultimate destination.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Kristin Huth
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Super cute play room with everything ur kid would want to play with. Kids didn‚Äôt want to leave

-----------------------

Reviewer: Amber Page
Rating: 1/5
Time: a year ago
Review: We celebrated my son turning 4 at VIP Kids. While the place was fine and the kids had fun, the customer service was non existent. We paid for a two hour party (2:30-4:30), but the employee was telling me 40 minutes before the party ended that I had to be out by 4:30. So I had to stop hosting to start packing everything up‚Ä¶ before my event ever ended?

We have done an indoor playground for 3 birthday parties now and this was by far the worst experience we‚Äôve had. The employees offered no assistance and rushed us out while having the next party people waiting in the lobby before our party ended.
Lastly, when booked they said that we would pay the deposit at that time and pay the remainder at the end of the party. Upon arrival they required payment before the party started.
Overall not a great experience and would not do a party there again.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Melanie Burns
Rating: 1/5
Time: Edited a year ago
Review: This place does definitely not resemble their name. They do NOT make you feel like a VIP.  Management needs a lesson in customer service. This is not a good place to spend your money.  That is all they care about. It‚Äôs basically one small room with a very small place area. I saw no video games. They are so small that if they have a private party that is all they can accommodate. They will ask u to leave. They are closed on Sunday which is crazy! They require everyone, including handicapped adults‚Äù to remove shoes and have soaks on. Even to sit on the couch. If u challenge them on anything they are rude to u. There are much nicer kid play areas in Las Vegas than this one to spend your money at. This place will not make it long. I have more toys in my back yard than they have at this place.

After reading the owner or managers response to my review. I‚Äôm editing my message. I would actually love for them to post the video of me going in there. Because that is not how things transpired.   When I walk in I ask about the hours and the cost to play. The girls at the front tell me That they are having a private party in 20 minutes and will be closing to the public. She said I should have called, but that I could fill out there forms and have a tour and a look around to check things out.
I also mentioned that I would‚Äôve called if my comment on her post had been responded to. Because It wasn‚Äôt I couldn‚Äôt find the post so I didnt remember the name or address. I proceeded to drive around the area trying to find it. I did not know their phone number or their name and I was looking for the original post so that I could call.
Yes, I was with the teenager and a one-year-old. They are my grandchildren. Yes, my one-year-old sat on toy car while I was reading their pricelist , took their tour which last about 3 minutes because it‚Äôs one tiny room,  I then took an important phone call. While i let my granddaughter , whom we had removed her shoes as requested so she could see if she was going to like it there , go check out the toys. Then I was Approached and asked to leave. I had been there maybe five minutes !!! Them saying I let my grandbaby play there is a stretch. She sat on a little toy car !! I was trying to see this was going to be something she would like to do. When I told the girl, I thought you said we had 20 minutes  She said , yeah we have to clean for the party. I was more than willing to pay for 20 minutes. Mind you. But they didn‚Äôt give me a price for that!!
I said ok fine. And we got ready to leave! She said I Stormed off? I walked out the door!! Yes that‚Äôs true My 16 year old grandson was getting his sister and putting her shoes on. That is because I am handicapped and I can  not lift her! how is it storming off???
I am in so many parenting groups that I will tell every single one of them not to take their kids there. I have never ever ever been treated so rudely in my life. I have worked in customer care for 35 years!  none of my friends are going to be interested in taking their kid to a place where if they have one party, they cannot accommodate anybody else.  It is literally one room with two little side closets. One where they sit down and have pizza and one where they have a little karaoke. There‚Äôs nothing there for teenagers. My teenager grandson said that he would not want to stay there at all ever for anything. And like I said, I have more toys in my backyard than they had in that place. not to mention you do not speak to potential customers like that.  Just how much do you think I should‚Äôve paid for my grandbaby to sit in a toy car for a minute?  I truly am curious how u treat children if this is how u treat their parents . Your business will be gone in a year. Unless it‚Äôs a money laundering business. .

-----------------------

Rating: 5/5

Review: This place rocks! We really love the space and how you can sit anywhere and relax and not have to worry about where your kids are especially if you have toddlers. They keep it clean and there‚Äôs plenty of toys and activities for kids to do. More affordable than other places too. We‚Äôre regulars here and we highly recommend it! Keep it up!

{Reviewer: Kenzie Ivory
Rating: 3/5
Time: a week ago
Review: Fun place for my 4 year old and 18 month old and it can keep them busy for hours! We mostly like to play outside in the summers but we love that they have a trampoline we can use and lots of things to climb on. It keeps my kids entertained and they love it here. I've been here a few times and I actively watch them and follow them to make sure they are safe and I personally think it is gross. Staff are teenagers that aren't very friendly and play on their phones the entire time. The 3 times I've been there I saw someone "clean" once. The girl just sprayed benches people weren't sitting on without wiping them down which isn't really cleaning. I also never personally saw them clean the playground. I don't know what their cleaning expectations are but I've been to other indoor playgrounds before I moved here that had employees go into the play area every hour with spray and cloths to wipe down the equipment and it always smelled clean. We will go here again most likely but I wish their staff would actually work and make the place a clean and friendly atmosphere like I'm sure the owners expect them and pay them to do.

Reviewer: Michael DuBois
Rating: 1/5

Review: Our experience with Coconut Cove was terrible from beginning to end. We booked a birthday party there for our 6 year old and some of his friends. The play equipment was not clean and there were a few areas that seemed unsafe, some holes in the netting, etc. The party attendees, including the birthday boy, left feeling pretty let down by the lack of rule enforcement and general mayhem. When trying to address these issues, we couldn't find a single adult employee to address these concerns. There were a few tennage-aged employees who didn't seem to know what was going on.

The real kicker in all of this, is that after we checked out with the front desk and left, they later had trouble running our card for the remaining balance due, which resulted in the owner reporting us to the Centerville Police for theft. After speaking with a police detective, we (ofcourse) paid the unpaid invoice. Needless to say, we won't ever be back to Coconut Cove again.

Reviewer: Amy Findlay
Rating: 3/5
Time: 11 months ago
Review: There were some fun activities for my older kiddo, but the overall feel was kind of dirty. The floors were gray, and the baby area was not very appropriate for my crawling baby. The floors were covered in crumbs and other garbage, which he naturally tried putting in his mouth. There was also like a giant soft toy the size of the wall in there that was easy for a baby to pull up on and have topple on them. There were honestly mostly older children playing in that section, even though it's only for babies. I understand that's the parent's job to watch, but I would recommend a better enclosure or something like maybe a baby gate or something? There was just a large soft block in place of a door, but my crawling baby kept climbing over it instead of playing with the other toys so I had to just stand next to him the whole time ensuring he didn't go over head first and hit his head. If it were more secure I could have at least sat down at the table right next to the baby zone instead of hovering. The other thing is that it's super difficult to see inside the play place. If parents aren't really supposed to be in there with their kids but are to watch their kids, there really needs to be some way to observe what is going on. There were multiple times I lost track of my son for several minutes just because of the layout. Maybe adding in mirrors or something to make it easier to see what is going on would make it a less stressful experience.
I think there is great potential. I love the idea of this place. I think people should support it, and hopefully management will continue to make improvements so our kids will keep having a fun indoor space to play.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Emily Salazar
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: My kids  ( 5 and 9) both loved this place and have been begging to come back again. Even all the adults seemed be enjoying themselves and playing along. We arrived right when they opened on a Friday and by noon, the place was packed with people. It was pretty clean and I saw the one employee  wiping the play area and tables down frequently. Pretty much when she wasn't helping a customer in any way, she was cleaning. All these other reviews claiming it was dirty, I think they're just being over the top and expecting the place to look brand new and never touched, which is impossible. I did see the sit and spins that were mentioned in other reviews that had damaged padding on the corners. They were  still damaged when we went, but they didn't seem to be a safety hazard either. And all of the air guns didn't seem to be working, which was a bummer, but there's so much else to do in there so it wasn't too much of a disappointment. I would recommend grippy socks for sure after seeing many kids slip and fall in the cement flooring outside of the play area. And their pizzas are a little small, but they aren't bad for the price. They don't taste like a frozen pizza someone just tossed in the oven. We felt like we were eating a made from scratch pizza.

"Do you guys police kids with their socks off running up the slides and crashing into other kids?" "We try to... (back to Pandora). Top 5 posted rules all broken. 1) Little to no parental supervision. 2) Socks not being worn by 25% of ALL kids everywhere. 3) Kids climbing up slides (en masse). 4) Rough play abounds. 5) Outside toys all over the place.

You have to do better, owners. I had to be overly vigilant and police other people's kids. If anyone has a lawsuit originating on 4/6/24 from 4:15-5:45 pm, let me know in will witness to the incompetence of the staff and the negligence of ownership.

Reviewer: Alyssa Dixon
Rating: 3/5
Time: 7 months ago
Review: 3 stars because though there are a lot of great things about it, the policies are just dumb. The staff was great, it was a fun place, pretty clean, and pretty good equipment - though it's not well lit, the drinking fountains were broken, and it was pretty cold inside. We had fun playing for my son's birthday party, but their party policies are unclear and confusing. Nowhere, when I booked the party (which includes entrance for 10 kids), did it say you can only arrive 5 minutes prior to the room reservation, which I didn't appreciate because I wanted to schedule the room for 5:00pm but couldn't because that wasn't an option (even though no one had the room booked before us) and we wanted to start the party then and play before eating pizza and cake at 6:00 (playing before eating, so kids don't get sick). It took several phone calls and convincing the manager to let us play before our room reservation (even though when we got there, there was almost no one else there). The website and signs on the door say "No outside food or drink", but then there is a place to eat food and the other guests I saw there were eating outside food, so it's stated everywhere but not enforced? For the party, we couldn't bring outside food (aside from the cake and water bottles), and had to order through them. BUT they only offered a couple kinds of pizza, and it turns out, they just go buy it from Marco's in Lindon. Good pizza, but why couldn't I buy it from Marco's or anywhere else myself and bring it in? Then I would've been able to have more choices than just pepperoni or cheese pizza. Plus, the staff member who went to pick it up got lost so we couldn't start our pizza party in the room until 25 minutes after our scheduled time anyway (poor kids were getting hungry). I asked if we could bring in a veggie or fruit tray (minimal mess and something healthy) and they absolutely refused saying it was against policy, but they don't offer anything healthy, just the pizza and juice boxes. I assumed they would have enough plates for us since we ordered 8 pizzas, but they only provided 10 plates for the kids (I guess adults don't get plates). I didn't know so I didn't bring our own and then they charge 50 cents a paper plate if you want any extras. It's truly wild! So yeah, the play place is safe and fun for the kids to play, but their party policies are nuts and don't make any sense, so I can't fully recommend it, for a birthday party, at least.
And FYI, the party rooms are pretty small so the kids fit fine but the adults were crowded around the edges just standing with only a few able to sit.

Reviewer: Janice ‚ÄúJan‚Äù Hartmann
Rating: 5/5
Time: Edited a year ago
Review: If you have a young child ages walking to eight ,  I highly recommend bringing them to Kids Town to play independently with the other children.

It's the perfect environment for their imagination to grow while exploring their own little town. Imagined by the owners' dream for children to have their own playtown, then hand crafted by her husband.  It's the most unique play experience in the area!

Reasonably priced for every two-hour experience, so that with a limited number of children participating at one time, they all benefit from being able to enjoy all the activities within the town. There's everything with working features; from a house, a school, a beauty shop, a pizza parlor, bakery, hamburger shop, car garage. Post Offiice, Toy shop with creative play, a Veterinarians shop to a market with adorable baskets to fill up their grocery cart with actual store items. Every detail is fashioned after real life with the child in mind.

They allow outside food and drink, although one can buy snacks and beverages there, one must sit at the tables proovided across the dividing street from the town to enjoy and watch your child at play.

The restrooms were clean and well stocked. I liked that the water fountain even included free refills for water bottles.

Pictures say a lot, so enjoy the ones I took, and I hope to see you there!!

We visited again for Christmas this year, on December 19th, and our grandson loved it even more I think, at age 4!

The entire staff is kind, couteous, and engaging! I apprecate their generous offerings for the children.

Reviewer: Cody Cakes
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 years ago
Review: I had my daughter's 7th birthday at Kids Town and it was amazing!!¬† We bought the venue out and had 29 children and about 24 adults.

The venue is perfect for the littles!!¬† While we didn't have any children over 7. I feel like kids might outgrow this stage of play around 8 or 9 tops, I may be wrong!¬† Some parents who have never been here commented that they would bring their child back, that it was a really cute venue!¬† It is large enough for the children to spread out so it's not too crowded in any one mini-busines¬†and plenty of tables, chairs and benches for the parents to sit.¬† The employees came around every-so-often to tidy the toys/accessories, putting the animal stuffies back at the vet, postcards back at the post office and groceries¬†back at the store.

Working with Becky was a pleasure and she made the planning process a breeze!¬† I contacted¬†her 3 months prior to the party date and secured my date with a deposit.¬† She was patient and kind, answering all of my planning¬†questions, making suggestions and recommendations.¬† It was really nice to know that there are add-ons to make the party planning easier on you:¬† scavenger hunt to find a key that will 'unlock' the goodie bags and cotton candy tokens from the 3D cotton candy machine.¬† One month prior to the party the color scheme was verified- as they provide matching balloons, tablecloths, plates, napkins, forks, juice boxes and small 8 oz. water bottles for the amount of children you have in attendance.¬† They also partner with a pizza restaurant and you choose your menu items and they order it for you.¬† Becky was wonderful in estimating the amount of pizza/food we needed and making suggestions when asked.¬† This entire process was seamless and EASY!

The party room is the perfect size! The existing wall decor/backdrop decorations provided were perfect (sheer backdrop with string lights, candy cart display table and vine greenery panels) and could be dressed up to suit any theme.¬† We did bring additional decorations like a balloon garland, some flag banners and a party banner to complete the look and everyone commented on how well decorated it was.

Multiple parents commented on how yummy the pizza was and where I got the cupcakes from.¬† 2 orders of chicken fingers were a hit, the BBQ Chicken Pizza was the first to disappear and it was a really cute touch, that someone from the pizza place drew in the pizza box to wish my kiddo a happy birthday.

Everyone texted and said they had a great time at the party.¬† So I think that sums up our 2 hours at Kids town- it was worth every penny, I had a great experience from start to finish and I highly recommend hosting your party here!

I understand not wanting to over crowd, but there were literally 5 kids and 1 was in a stroller. Kids Town, you should AT LEAST offer a pro rate price for joining a session already in progress ESPECIALLY when there isn't anyone there. I was disappointmented because I was really interested in trying this place out, but after seeing in person, we were very underwhelmed. We ended up going to LOL Kids 6 minutes down the street, paid $20 (with Groupon) and stayed for 3 hours. After this experience we're no longer interested in trying out this place.

Review: This place has a good thought process behind its purpose as an alternative play and learning place for children.  As a teacher of over 25 years, the concept is good but the pricing is WOW!!! Review: First time here was today and I have to say, I was beyond impressed and can‚Äôt wait to come back - and we live an hour away! Having a very active 2.5 year old means I‚Äôve been to countless playgrounds (indoor and outdoor) and this was the most relaxed I‚Äôve felt as far as safety goes and a new favorite, hands down.

For starters, the playground itself is adult friendly all the way up to the top. This is crucial for my child‚Äôs age.  Some playgrounds you have to just watch from the bottom and hope that they are OK. Or‚Ä¶ you think you‚Äôre good to join your toddler, and then once you‚Äôre up there, there‚Äôs a part at the top that is too tight of a squeeze for most adults‚Ä¶ then you‚Äôre stuck forcing your screaming toddler to come back down since you‚Äôre worried about their safety. But even without parents *inside* the playground itself, it was so easy to supervise from down below and I have zero concerns about any areas she could have fallen down or been unsafe in any way. The design is absolutely perfect. Thankfully we came at a not busy time, so she had lots of room to run and play freely for 2.5 hours.

And on top of that - the cleanliness was noticed and appreciated so much. Staff was continuously sanitizing every surface. I was surprised to even see a staff member sanitizing a padded pole in the middle of a sitting area.

Reviewer: R David
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: We were in Vegas for a week (end of August) and attended this facility about 4-5 times. We had a fantastic experience. The owners were incredibly friendly and accommodating. Most importantly, the facility is more intimate and not as loud/hectic as other indoor playgrounds.

There are plenty of different toys for children to experience. We really valued that the size was more intimate (it made our children less distracted and not as over stimulated as the louder, super bright/neon/flashy places) but most importantly, this Wigglin' Out is OPEN EARLIER than all the other places.

The earlier open hours were key because most children are up early so to have to wait until 11 am to start burning off energy is too close to lunch/nap times. Now keep in mind, we were visiting from Canada so I recognize that earlier weekday hours may not be as important for locals.

But for us, as tourists, this venue was excellent: wonderful customer service, more calm/intimate setting, and better opening hours.

Reviewer: Shien Zou
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 years ago
Review: I came with a group of 6 kids (from 2-4 yo) and 7 adults during Independence Day weekend and we had the place to ourselves. The kids had crazy amounts of fun and the adults were enjoying not being bothered as the staff helped whenever she saw a child struggling anywhere. Some of the kids started out scared, but she helped us encourage them and told us how to guide them. It was the first time for all the kids to experience such a huge ball pit and tall slides. The rope bridge to the trampoline was ultra cool. They used the space under the structure really well. We took turns going to the nearby Dice Bowl for some tasty drinks and the kids never noticed. A sign of a great play place.

We didn't buy any snacks, but it's a decent selection with slightly higher prices, nothing crazy. I really appreciated the bathroom setup with a changing table and wipes in both single bathrooms as my 2 year old decided that was the best time to go #2. The bathroom was very clean, as was all of the facility. The shoes off policy is a great idea.

We're definitely coming back as the kids really enjoyed their time here. We were there for a party, and as far as I can tell, the price was reasonable and certainly well worth it. The normal entry prices seem standard for this type of place. A good time was had by all (including the adults, I also enjoyed swimming in the ball pit).

Reviewer: B
Rating: 1/5
Time: Edited a month ago
Review: I have been here multiple times, and I almost booked a birthday party here one year.. but we were in the area so I had decided to play here last Sunday. But we couldn‚Äôt even get inside. And after I found out what happened, I will NEVER return.
The parking lot had at least 30 cops, and I asked one grandma, as She was being shuffled out of the building, what happened? This is as the police were taping off the parking lot area, and eventually, the front door after hurrying several other people out of there. She told me, ‚Äúgo, get out of here! There was gunfire! Go!‚Äù I will absolutely not return after that, for obvious reasons.

But despite that incident‚Ä¶ I would still give this place 1 star because they never keep anything clean. We used to come here a lot, but we had stopped and went to different indoor playgrounds because nearly every time that we would come here, within the next 2-3 days, my kid was sick. And he would end up with an ear infection as a result, and it was really bad. It was at least three separate times that we came to LOL and my son was sick a couple days after.
My son was only 2 then, and I was at home with him all the time.. he couldn‚Äôt have got sick from anywhere but here as he was not in daycare, and we really didn‚Äôt leave the house very much at all, therefore I know that it had to have been at LOL that he got sick. Kids will be running around coughing and sneezing and still playing and touching everything. If your kid is sick you should not bring them out to a place like this, obviously, but soo many people do it anyways! So rude.

The staff could have done temperate checks during cold/flu season? Or if they saw an obviously sick child, ask the family to leave and sanitize the area? But you don‚Äôt see the staff ever cleaning anything here. The tables are a mess a lot of the time, the play area is worse. They only walk around with a leaf blower to ‚Äúclean‚Äù up the ballpit balls that have gone astray. Never seen anyone wipe anything down.
You can tell they don‚Äôt really care to clean much of the many surfaces because obvious shoe marks, dirt, etc. all over the play area and floor. The ball pit balls feel disgusting and greasy. It‚Äôs the worst on the high levels of the play area. I‚Äôve climbed to the very top which is very high up and that‚Äôs where it looks the dirtiest, probably because it‚Äôs not as accessible as the ground floor and most parents aren‚Äôt up there to notice. But why are there dirty shoe marks when it is a ‚Äúsocks only‚Äù facility anyways?!

It is too bad the staff/owner don‚Äôt really care, because this place would be great if I was just judging the playground equipment! Unfortunately, they allow in what I feel like is more than their capacity should be, and the place is flooded with kids running left and right, no staff supervision anywhere at all, and they don‚Äôt clean a thing afterwards.
The owners obviously don‚Äôt care to change their policies and improve this place as I‚Äôve seen numerous other reviews that were recently posted.
Overall they lack sanitation for a children‚Äôs facility and we saw the aftermath of an extremely dangerous hazard in a children‚Äôs play place‚Ä¶ so thankful we weren‚Äôt inside when this occurred and I hope everyone was okay.
I hope they get shut down after this incident, it is so not ok for this to have been happening at a place for kids. If they stay open I think they should install metal detectors & hire a decent cleaning crew to sanitize this place.
Will never return ever. I already avoided coming here when my kid would ask, instead I‚Äôd suggest a different indoor playground, but now it will be a hard no.
I wouldn‚Äôt have even came here today in the first place, but we happened to be nearby on that side of town, so I said fine we will go.
But driving there, I kept telling my son, don‚Äôt put your hands in your mouth or on your face, unless you want to get sick!

Reviewer: Gianna Griffin
Rating: 1/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: My daughter recently hosted my twin granddaughter's birthday party at LOL Kids, and unfortunately, I can‚Äôt recommend this place. My daughter paid $1600 for their Ultimate Package, which included 3 rooms, food (8 large pizzas, 2 appetizer platters, 2 salad platters), unlimited drinks, and icee treats for the kids. While the price was hefty, we expected great service and a smooth experience for such a special occasion ‚Äì but that wasn‚Äôt the case.

Issues we faced:
1.	Shoes Policy Problems: Upon arrival, we were told all adults had to remove their shoes. This included elders and people with health issues who would be sitting the entire time. We had to argue with staff to get waivers to allow our elderly family members to keep their shoes on, which should have been handled more gracefully.

2.	Room Mix-Up: To our surprise, when we got to our reserved rooms, they were given away to another party. We spent nearly 45 minutes sorting this out, and the issue wasn‚Äôt resolved until we spoke with the owner. The excuse they gave was that they thought we were part of another party, but no one bothered to confirm anything. It was very frustrating, and we didn‚Äôt even get into our rooms until an hour after the scheduled party time. As compensation for the inconvenience, the owner gave us a frozen tiramisu cake and two fruit trays ‚Äì hardly an adequate fix.

3.	Poor Food and Service: The service at the party was subpar. The host was unprofessional, and we had to repeatedly ask for refills on drinks and inquire about the food. We were given random food substitutions, like ranch dressing instead of the Caesar dressing we ordered. When we asked the staff about it, they acted like they didn‚Äôt know what we were talking about, and one of the workers at the register admitted they had just run out of the correct dressing. Additionally, we had to keep asking for plates, cups, and basic items, which seemed to annoy the host.

For the amount of money we paid, we expected much better service and attention to detail. The staff seemed disorganized and uninterested in providing a positive experience.
Final Thoughts: If you‚Äôre planning to book a party for your children here, be prepared for potential stress and poor service. The lack of professionalism, mix-ups with reservations, and inattentiveness from the staff made this a frustrating and disappointing experience. For the price, there are certainly better venues that will respect your time, money, and your child‚Äôs special day.

Reviewer: Mama_ KT_
Rating: 1/5
Time: 10 months ago
Review: I never thought I'd leave a review wishing for a zero or negative star option, but here we are. I've been to this children's play place more than once, and my previous experience was disappointing due to the cleanliness of the play area and the staff's attitude. We let a Groupon expire because I didn‚Äôt want to return. But after my daughter kept asking to go for the last two weeks, I figured we‚Äôd give it another shot, hoping it had improved. Unfortunately, it‚Äôs worse than ever.

We visited on Saturday, 8/24/24, meeting friends for a playdate when the place opened. After letting the kids (both 5 years old) settle in, we sat down, periodically checking on them. The floors in the seating areas were filthy, covered in shoe and sock prints, and this was right after opening. Then, my daughter came over and told me she stepped on glass. Shocked, I asked her to show me where. Meanwhile, her friend showed her mom a small injury she had gotten while trying to avoid the glass, causing her to fall and land on the glass, which ripped her new leggings and cut her knee, making it bleed.

I walked over and saw glass scattered everywhere near the front windows. Another parent mentioned that their child had found the rock that had clearly broken the window. When my friend asked for a bandaid and the staff saw her daughter's bleeding leg, they told her it had already been cleaned up. I then informed them that was definitely not the case; glass was still all over the mats. This is a play place where kids are required to wear socks only. One child was already bleeding, and that was the staff‚Äôs response? A few of us parents started using toys to barricade off the area because the glass had spread over a large area. There was no urgency from the staff; they eventually came over with brooms and said, "It's not our fault people keep breaking our windows." True, it‚Äôs not their fault, but it is their responsibility to maintain a safe environment for the kids.

Despite our concerns, the girls wanted to keep playing, so we kept them away from that area. The staff‚Äôs cleaning efforts were inadequate‚Äîthey didn‚Äôt even bother to get a vacuum to clean up the shards of glass on the mats. They removed our barricades. It wasn‚Äôt until the owner arrived later that the staff finally brought out a shop vac and sealed the window to clean up the glass properly. Yet, the owner never checked in with my friend to see how her daughter was doing.

When our kids got hungry, we ordered food: one large pizza and an order of chicken spring rolls. The food took a long time to arrive. When I bit into the spring rolls, I found a triangular piece of bone inside the chopped chicken. I took multiple pictures as proof. Then I noticed a rash on my friend‚Äôs daughter, which hadn‚Äôt been there before. That was the last straw; we decided it was time to go.

This place is a disaster‚Äîthe staff is terrible, and there‚Äôs zero regulation on older kids roughhousing. An older boy, maybe 8-10 years old, was grabbing my daughter‚Äôs hands in the ball pit, and I had to intervene calmly. No parents were in sight.

When you go to a play place, there‚Äôs an expectation of cleanliness, kindness, and safety‚Äîthis place has none of those. To top it off, only one sink in the women‚Äôs bathroom worked, the paper towel dispenser handle was broken, one toilet was out of order, and another was clogged. The toys, like the large Legos and the balls, were filthy, and even my daughter mentioned that the slides were dirty.

We had to explain to our girls that we were leaving because it wasn‚Äôt safe‚Äîbetween the broken glass, the bone in my food, and the rash, it was time to go and never come back. I‚Äôve mentioned this experience to other mom friends, and they all had horrible things to say about this place. I have no idea how this place is still open; it needs to be shut down.

Review: We went on a Saturday night, and it wasn't crazy busy, which I was happy about. It's a very large play place, and sometimes, when it's too busy, the little ones get hurt/run over by older kids. All the kids, for the most part, appeared to be under 6 when I was there.  The jungle gym is big enough that a parent is able to climb through it as well. Seemed pretty clean, didn't go to the restrooms which I hate because you're in socks only. They have some arcade games, but after spending $18 to get in, it can get expensive playing games. The birthday space I wasn't impressed with simply because it's all linked together in one large room.  Just rows of tables, maybe 10 - 15, so you don't have a personal space. You're behind glass separated from the general public, but not from anyone else having a birthday party at the same time. There's plenty of seating available for parents while the kids play, and the snack bar has a nice variety of items. Pricing wise they're high, but it's a play place so I expected it. It was almost $7 for a small slurpee (6 or 8oz I believe) and bottle of water.  The air guns in the playpen weren't working and there are several of them. Looked like no one had checked them to see because balls were stuck in them that weren't intended for the guns. I wasn't able to pull them out, and even guns that had nothing stuck in them weren't working either. Overall, my daughter enjoyed herself so I'd definitely go back.

Reviewer: Susan H
Rating: 1/5
Time: 11 months ago
Review: Unfortunately we had a really awful experience at Yuzu and Space, and I don't recommend booking a birthday party here. I hosted my daughter's birthday party here after speaking with the owner, Rhuna extensively beforehand she promised activities like painting  and making friendship bracelets. Unfortunately, neither of these activities took place. The owner (again Rhuna), who was extemely friendly when we arrived, disappeared into a back office and barely interacted with us.

The party was supposed to last a total of three hours, but I cut it short by over an hour because of the owner's behavior. After two hours or so of hiding in the back, she emerged extremely angry because the kids had made a mess. These were small children 2-4 year olds without any guidance or structured activities, which she had promised to provide. Instead of getting defensive I apologized and I tried to help clean up, but her negative energy made everyone feel unwelcome. She was scowling and giving off a horrible vibe and I became worried she would cause a scene.

I had also purchased a pi√±ata with her approval to schedule that at the end of the party, but we didn't get to use it because we had cut the party short. Rhuna became very aggressive towards my husband, and I was so embarrassed in front of our guests that I left to wait in the car. I didn't want my daughter to know anything was wrong, so I didn't want to complain in front of her or have her realize we were leaving early. My husband paid the full amount and we just asked our guests to leave without much explanation because they all realized she was making a problem.

To make matters worse the owner later posted on social media, complaining about us. She never communicated any expectations of parents or asked us to do something different beforehand. Instead, she hid in her office and suddenly came out without warning, seemingly perturbed.

We were told we would have a fun birthday party with painting and bracelet crafts, and I assumed there would be helpers to set this up and guide the kids. Despite the lack of promised activities, I didn't complain because I just wanted the kids to have fun and they were having a good time. I hope the owner can learn to communicate and plan better, but we certainly won't be back. I have been to many birthday parties for friends kids and planned my kid's at many locations and never once was anyone treated this way. My intention was to support a new local business and try out a new place but it turned into an unfortunate and embarrassing fiasco.

-----------------------
