Reviewer: R David
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: We were in Vegas for a week (end of August) and attended this facility about 4-5 times. We had a fantastic experience. The owners were incredibly friendly and accommodating. Most importantly, the facility is more intimate and not as loud/hectic as other indoor playgrounds.

There are plenty of different toys for children to experience. We really valued that the size was more intimate (it made our children less distracted and not as over stimulated as the louder, super bright/neon/flashy places) but most importantly, this Wigglin' Out is OPEN EARLIER than all the other places.

The earlier open hours were key because most children are up early so to have to wait until 11 am to start burning off energy is too close to lunch/nap times. Now keep in mind, we were visiting from Canada so I recognize that earlier weekday hours may not be as important for locals.

But for us, as tourists, this venue was excellent: wonderful customer service, more calm/intimate setting, and better opening hours.

Review: DANGER! Don't Bring Your Little Kids Here!
I brought my 3 year old here today and it's full of adults barreling down the slides head-first (without kids) and teenagers bullying little kids on the trampoline. The big kids - far too old to be there were boisterous and dangerous, pushing little ones over. It isn't a place for little kids.

There was a 350lb man up on the climbing frame net area making the whole thing creak and shake and the useless TEEN staff (clearly management doesn't want to pay adults!) couldn't manage anything. It is a matter of time until that comes down on someone's head.

The whole place is a disaster and danger to children. There should be an upper age restriction on how old kids can be to enter - it's not a place for the over 10s and this was being exploited because of the useless management.

The running around of a 5-year-old does not have the same momentum as a ten-year-old running around, ploughing into little ones. Again, the little mouse voices from 'management' did nothing and the trash parents were more interested in their phones than watching their kids. Upon entry, they should be spoken to about watching their kids, not to let them bully and over tens should be turned away.

Also, their toxic stamp takes 60 years to remove and will make my kid's arm red in the bathtub, trying to get it off.

Avoid. At all costs. It's a matter of time until a kid is really hurt - or worse at this clown show and they get sued into oblivion regardless of their stupid waiver or signs, that no one reads.
If I could rate it minus stars, I would.
We will never be back and we'll be telling other parents to avoid the place too.

Reviewer: Amber Swint
Rating: 1/5

Review: ***WARNING*** Worst Birthday Party experience ever......

We booked the party in Aug. For today Nov. 11th. At the time of booking I was told IF more than 15 kids showed I would be charged for the 22 child count party. OK not a problem.

I was also told we would get 2 full hours in the party room.

When I arrived today I was CHARGED for the 22 child party as soon as I walk through the door. They did not even wait for the head count. Then also asked for a TIP. Right as we arrived.

The employees could have cared less about helping us set up the party!!!

The "party host" with the party was virtually none existent. We did basically everything ourselves from set up to clean up!

When the party was about over we were told to vacate the party room before the party for even over. BEFORE the 2 hour mark! The hostess finally showed up and said we could stay additional time for another $50.00.

When I went to the cashier she number 1 refused to give us out money back because it was a 15 child party not 22.

Secondly, she refused to give us an additional few mintues in the party room that the hostess communicated we could pay for.

NOT one person was kind or courteous. There was very poor communication. We were for lack of better terms over charged for the party head count.

Not a family friendly or good customer service experience at all.

When I asked to speak with a manager I was told I had to wait until Monday and call them.

Despite Kangamoos extremely poor customer service. We tipped the one person who did check on us well.

Needless to say, unless this very Bad experience is addressed.  NONE of us at the party plan to visit this establishment again in the future.

Dear manager. Call Me! Signed an overcharged patron!

I will gladly update this review IF management contacts me to corrext this wrong and experience. B Because they will deserve a kudos for effort. I have to wait until Monday to talk with anyone.

Review: This place was nice and my kids loved it to be honest. Only down side was the interaction we had with 1 employee. Long story short we went upstairs to sit down after being cramped in one of the downstairs room for a hour. I asked the young lady if the private parties were over and she told me yes, they ended at 330. So we grabbed all our stuff and headed upstairs. About 30 minutes later, my partner had someone very politely come up to her and explain more parties were coming and that we need to go downstairs, she complied with no problem. My partner starts to tell me that we need to leave( I didn‚Äôt hear conversation ) but we are interrupted by the original employee who told me that the parties were over. She starts repeatedly telling us we can‚Äôt be upstairs, and asking if we were apart if a party. We told her no, that we are leaving. She repeats the same questions over again, with her voice raised louder, so finally I said I heard you the first 3 times, we are leaving. And that We paid 50 dollars to be here, we thought we could sit anywhere we like. She finally backs off and we quickly go downstairs. After we make it back downstairs, the original young lady who told us more parties are coming, comes up and apologies for the way her coworker talked to us. She felt so bad that she gave us free admission tickets too. To end this long story, maybe Planet Kid shouldn‚Äôt book 75% of the place up, and make the people not there for a party sit in a tiny room cramped together. Maybe just book the upstairs, and be very clear you can‚Äôt sit up there if you are not apart of a party. Shout out to the young lady who eased over the situation.

Rating: 1/5

Then my daughter chose a snack, but I was without my wallet waiting for my husband to arrive in 10 minutes and the attendant was super rude saying that I couldn't open the snack package without first having to pay $1. Reviewer: C Y
Rating: 5/5

Reviewer: Debi Good
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 years ago

I saw reviews complaining about snacks but we found that they had a variety which included some pretty healthy options at fair prices. It got busy at midday but most parents were supervising and our grandson enjoyed playing with the other kids. If we have opportunity we will definitely return. Reviewer: Jaimie Schaneman
Rating: 5/5

Reviewer: Lori Mills
Rating: 5/5

Reviewer: Jenn T.
Rating: 5/5

The actual play area was very spacious with 2 trampolines, several slides, and many more nooks and crannies where adults can fit but kids enjoy climbing around in. We booked the party in Aug. For today Nov. 11th. At the time of booking I was told IF more than 15 kids showed I would be charged for the 22 child count party. OK not a problem.

I was also told we would get 2 full hours in the party room.

When I arrived today I was CHARGED for the 22 child party as soon as I walk through the door. They did not even wait for the head count. Then also asked for a TIP. Right as we arrived.

The employees could have cared less about helping us set up the party!!!

The "party host" with the party was virtually none existent. We did basically everything ourselves from set up to clean up!

When the party was about over we were told to vacate the party room before the party for even over. BEFORE the 2 hour mark! The hostess finally showed up and said we could stay additional time for another $50.00.

When I went to the cashier she number 1 refused to give us out money back because it was a 15 child party not 22.

Secondly, she refused to give us an additional few mintues in the party room that the hostess communicated we could pay for.

NOT one person was kind or courteous. There was very poor communication. We were for lack of better terms over charged for the party head count.

Not a family friendly or good customer service experience at all.

When I asked to speak with a manager I was told I had to wait until Monday and call them.

Despite Kangamoos extremely poor customer service. We tipped the one person who did check on us well.

Needless to say, unless this very Bad experience is addressed.  NONE of us at the party plan to visit this establishment again in the future.

Dear manager. Call Me! Signed an overcharged patron!

I will gladly update this review IF management contacts me to corrext this wrong and experience. B Because they will deserve a kudos for effort. I have to wait until Monday to talk with anyone.

Reviewer: Cody Burch
Rating: 5/5

The employees are VERY nice- wonderful people, and I haven't met one that hasn't been awesome, and very helpful. Also, they offer 4 FREE massage chairs for the parents! They offer toys for sale for the kids, give free balloon animals, have people come by dressed up as their mascot, as well as other performers some times, and I've done my research- these guys have THE best prices in all of Vegas. Their year ticket is the way to go if you plan on coming back. Their playground is adaptable for children between the ages of under 1 year (crawling) and even up to 6 or even 7, maybe higher, depending upon the children's level of interest in playhouses, tunnels, slides, costumes, games, play cars, etc. Overall, I recommend them over any other indoor playground in all of Las Vegas.

Reviewer: Christine Duh
Rating: 5/5

Rating: 5/5

Original Review

Reviewer: brylle estrada

Reviewer: Samantha Brandt

Reviewer: Telu Ramos
Rating: 4/5
Time: Edited 4 years ago

Reviewer: Rositsa Petkova
Rating: 5/5

Reviewer: Shaytoya Marie
Rating: 1/5
Time: 2 years ago
Review: I do not usually post negative Reviews but this location made me feel very unsafe as a parent with more than one child I was watching!! We went to this location September4 24th 2022 was super busy that day.

I watched 2 of my children as they ran back & forth from the front of entrance. Plus breast feed my daughter so my hands were pretty full.

I almost had an heart attack when I could not see my son any more after noticing that the side door was open from people having an event the only thing that blocks from the event is a sign.

Which to me is totally unsafe any child could walk out from the side since the staff isn't doing a great job with making sure that side gate is shut. Plus where the bathrooms are at it takes you to the same hallways with out having a door or gate. There should be a gate anyway's where events are hosted since kids go back & forth to the play ground.

The play area is too big to have the ability to see the kids once they go up & play so I would not know where my son had exited

Thank goodness my son was just in the slide.

Whats the point of the gate in the front if a child or an adult that is not meant to be there can go through the side entrance of the parties or where the bathrooms are located.

But personally I would never ever come to this location ever again. Due to this reason I hope you guys take this into consideration & add a gate instead of just having a poster board blocking the entrance to the hallway.

Reviewer: Ka'iulani Awa
Rating: 5/5

Reviewer: Angela Winward
Rating: 5/5

Rating: 1/5

Reviewer: Kathy Cumplido
Rating: 5/5

Reviewer: Hannah D
Rating: 4/5
Time: 6 years ago
Review: The play structure is very unique, not your typical McDonald‚Äôs play place. For $10 a kid (adults free) it‚Äôs a great price. They didn‚Äôt inform me on a time limit, we stayed for 4 hours! Reviewer: vidya m
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 months ago
Review: I LOVE THIS PLACE!!
There are so many great things about it ‚Äî it‚Äôs women-owned, has an incredible staff, and is the perfect spot for work-from-home parents. While you plug into high-speed internet and get work done, the staff takes wonderful care of your children.

They offer free coffee with every check-in (yes, free coffee!), and if you‚Äôre like me and always need a second cup, the prices are super reasonable. The snack options for kids are thoughtful, and the fresh, fruit-infused water is such a refreshing touch.

Reviewer: Sam Villanueva
Rating: 5/5
Time: a month ago
Review: Wally Wombats is hands down one of the most delightful and family-friendly indoor playgrounds I‚Äôve ever visited. From the moment you step inside, you‚Äôre greeted by a warm and welcoming atmosphere that feels like a breath of fresh air for parents and an absolute wonderland for kids. The space is immaculately clean, thoughtfully designed, and bursting with creative energy‚Äîit's clear the team behind Wally Wombats truly cares about making every visit a memorable experience.

The play structures are incredible‚Äîcolorful, safe, and engaging for a wide range of ages. My kids could have stayed for hours exploring the climbing walls, tunnels, and slides, while the soft play areas are perfect for little ones who are just learning to crawl and walk. I especially appreciate the attention to safety: the staff keeps a watchful eye on the play zones, and everything from the flooring to the equipment feels high-quality and well-maintained.

What really sets Wally Wombats apart, though, is the heart behind it. The staff is exceptional‚Äîkind, patient, and genuinely enthusiastic about creating a positive environment. They go above and beyond to ensure families feel welcome and supported, whether it‚Äôs helping with a birthday party setup or offering a friendly smile when you need a coffee break. Speaking of which, the caf√© area is a fantastic touch! It‚Äôs a cozy space where parents can relax while the kids play, and the menu has plenty of options that make it easy to refuel without leaving the building.

Wally Wombats is also an incredible spot for hosting parties and special events. Their team takes care of the details so you can actually enjoy the day with your family, and they make every celebration feel special and unique.

Whether you're looking for a safe, engaging place for your kids to burn off energy or a welcoming community space for families to connect, Wally Wombats delivers in every way. It‚Äôs a gem in the community, and I couldn‚Äôt recommend it more highly. If you‚Äôre in the area, do yourself and your family a favor‚Äîcome experience the magic of Wally Wombats!

Reviewer: Sam Villanueva
Rating: 5/5
Time: a month ago
Review: Wally Wombats is hands down one of the most delightful and family-friendly indoor playgrounds I‚Äôve ever visited. From the moment you step inside, you‚Äôre greeted by a warm and welcoming atmosphere that feels like a breath of fresh air for parents and an absolute wonderland for kids. The space is immaculately clean, thoughtfully designed, and bursting with creative energy‚Äîit's clear the team behind Wally Wombats truly cares about making every visit a memorable experience.

The play structures are incredible‚Äîcolorful, safe, and engaging for a wide range of ages. My kids could have stayed for hours exploring the climbing walls, tunnels, and slides, while the soft play areas are perfect for little ones who are just learning to crawl and walk. I especially appreciate the attention to safety: the staff keeps a watchful eye on the play zones, and everything from the flooring to the equipment feels high-quality and well-maintained.

What really sets Wally Wombats apart, though, is the heart behind it. The staff is exceptional‚Äîkind, patient, and genuinely enthusiastic about creating a positive environment. They go above and beyond to ensure families feel welcome and supported, whether it‚Äôs helping with a birthday party setup or offering a friendly smile when you need a coffee break. Speaking of which, the caf√© area is a fantastic touch! It‚Äôs a cozy space where parents can relax while the kids play, and the menu has plenty of options that make it easy to refuel without leaving the building.

Wally Wombats is also an incredible spot for hosting parties and special events. Their team takes care of the details so you can actually enjoy the day with your family, and they make every celebration feel special and unique.

Whether you're looking for a safe, engaging place for your kids to burn off energy or a welcoming community space for families to connect, Wally Wombats delivers in every way. It‚Äôs a gem in the community, and I couldn‚Äôt recommend it more highly. If you‚Äôre in the area, do yourself and your family a favor‚Äîcome experience the magic of Wally Wombats!

Lastly about cleanliness, I feel they have always done their best to keep toys sanitized.  They opened their doors when all the COVID shutdowns were happening, so from the get go that was important to them.
